title: CCG authorisation waves agreed | NHS England
kg_matched_categories: Event type; Career stage
kg_matched_entities: board; meeting
content_excerpt: The NHS Commissioning Board Authority is being asked to approve the timing of the four CCG authorisation waves. A paper going to the 31 May 2012 board meeting outlines how all 212 proposed CCG applicants have now agreed their wave. Applications for CCG authorisation will take place from July to November 2012 and the NHS Commissioning Board is on schedule to have completed the authorisation process by January 2013. The wave process will comprise: 35 proposed CCGs in wave one; 70 in wave two; 67 i

content_excerpt: The NHS Commissioning Board Authority has today completed the recruitment of its national leadership team with the appointment of Tim Kelsey as National Director for Patients and Information. Tim is currently Executive Director of Transparency and Open Data for HM Government where he has been responsible for government policy on transparency and open government. title: Landmark moment on the road to authorisation – Barbara Hakin | NHS England
kg_matched_categories: National priorities; Tags; Clinical discipline; Region
kg_matched_entities: acute care common stem; communities of practice; stem; practice; england
content_excerpt: Last week we reached a real landmark moment in the journey towards developing CCGs and the new clinically-led commissioning system. As you will have heard, we now have proposed CCGs covering the whole of England. That means 212 groups of practices have chosen to come together to shape and commission services to deliver better care, better experience, better outcomes and improved safety for their local populations. We shouldn’t underestimate the hard work that has taken place to get us where we a
